attributes.comment:
Director, Regulatory Management Division, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration
Services, Department of Homeland Security, 111 Massachusetts Avenue, NW.,
3rd Floor, Washington, DC 20529

DHS Docket No.: USCIS 2006-0044

Dear Sir/ Madam,

I am one of the Permanent Resident who's seeking and dying to be a lawful US
Citizen. I am married with Two adult kids. We came here since last July 2002
and we are just waiting our Five Years Term this July 2007 to apply for a
Citizenship. However, that you have a proposed Application Fee Hike. I'm worried
that you will implement that raised as soon as possible before my filling term. It's
really expensive for us to pay for Four (4) Person for the filling fee of $1,600
including the Fingerprinting Fee. We are just in the middle class of society and
receiving just enough for us to live here in America and support my Two kids in
College/University. What more if you will raise the amount for 85%? That will be
$2,960 for all of us just for one family. This is too much money for us to in spite of
the on going proposed Increases.

If you will permit/allow us to file now, We really appreciate it. We are just hoping
that you will allowed us to file as soon as possible before the increase will be
implemented.

Thank you and more power.

Yours truly,

Mrs. Flocer Sobrera
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Flocer Sobrera
